# Healthcare Telemedicine Platform SLA

## 1. Introduction

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA") defines the terms and conditions for the Healthcare Telemedicine Platform service provided to healthcare organizations. This document establishes performance metrics and outlines remedies in the event of service degradation or failure.

## 2. Service Availability

Service Provider guarantees a Monthly Uptime Percentage of 99.99% for the Telemedicine Platform core services. Video consultation services guarantee 99.9% availability. Service availability is measured based on the ability of authorized users to access and use the platform functions.

### 2.1 Calculation of Monthly Uptime

Monthly Uptime Percentage = (Total Minutes in a Month - Downtime Minutes) / Total Minutes in a Month × 100

### 2.2 Scheduled Maintenance

Scheduled Maintenance will be performed during predetermined maintenance windows, communicated at least 7 days in advance. Standard maintenance windows occur between 2:00 AM and 5:00 AM in the Customer's primary time zone on Sunday mornings. Emergency maintenance may be performed with 24-hour notice for critical security patches.

## 3. Performance Standards

### 3.1 Video Quality

The Telemedicine Platform will maintain the following video quality standards:

- HD quality (720p) video for 95% of consultations with adequate bandwidth
- Video frame rate of at least 25 fps for 98% of consultations
- Audio-video sync within 50ms for 99% of consultations
- Automatic quality adjustment based on available bandwidth

### 3.2 System Response Time

- Web interface response time: < 2 seconds for 95% of requests
- Mobile application response time: < 3 seconds for 95% of requests
- Video session initialization: < 5 seconds for 95% of connections
- Medical device data integration: < 3 seconds for 95% of data transmissions

### 3.3 Capacity

- Support for up to 1,000 concurrent video sessions per region
- Support for up to 10,000 concurrent users accessing the platform
- Automatic scaling during peak usage periods

## 4. Health Data Security & Privacy

### 4.1 Compliance

- HIPAA and HITECH compliance for all patient data
- End-to-end encryption for all video consultations
- BAA (Business Associate Agreement) included
- Annual third-party HIPAA security assessments
- Support for customer-specific compliance requirements

### 4.2 Data Protection

- No persistent storage of video/audio content without explicit consent
- Encryption of all stored patient data using AES-256
- Multi-factor authentication for all provider accounts
- Audit logging of all access to PHI
- Geo-fencing capabilities to restrict access by location

## 5. Support Services

### 5.1 Technical Support

| Support Tier | Hours of Operation | Initial Response Time |
|--------------|-------------------|----------------------|
| Standard | 8am-8pm, Mon-Fri | 2 hours |
| Enhanced | 24/7 | 1 hour |
| Premium | 24/7 | 15 minutes |

### 5.2 Incident Response

Incidents are categorized and responded to according to the following schedule:

| Severity | Description | Initial Response | Resolution Target | Updates |
|----------|-------------|------------------|-------------------|----------|
| Critical | Complete platform outage | 15 minutes | 2 hours | Every 30 minutes |
| High | Major function unavailable | 30 minutes | 4 hours | Every hour |
| Medium | Function degraded | 2 hours | 8 hours | Every 4 hours |
| Low | Minor issue | 8 hours | 24 hours | Daily |

## 6. Clinical Continuity

### 6.1 Failover Mechanism

- Automatic failover to backup video provider if primary fails
- Offline mode for essential functions during connectivity issues
- Rapid session recovery in case of disconnection
- Alternative communication channels (SMS, phone) integrated

### 6.2 Clinical Workflow Protection

- Zero data loss for clinical documentation
- Continuous saving of encounter notes during session
- Automatic resumption of interrupted sessions
- Patient queue preservation during system restarts

## 7. Service Credits

If Service Provider fails to meet the Service Availability commitment, Customer shall be eligible for Service Credits as follows:

| Monthly Uptime | Service Credit |
|----------------|---------------|
| < 99.99% but ≥ 99.9% | 10% of monthly fee |
| < 99.9% but ≥ 99.0% | 25% of monthly fee |
| < 99.0% | 50% of monthly fee |

### 7.1 Additional Performance Credits

Failure to meet any of the following performance metrics will result in additional service credits:

| Performance Metric | Threshold | Service Credit |
|--------------------|-----------|---------------|
| Video Quality | Below HD for >10% of sessions | 5% of monthly fee |
| Initial Connection Time | >10 seconds for >5% of sessions | 5% of monthly fee |
| Session Drops | >1% of total sessions | 10% of monthly fee |

## 8. Disaster Recovery

- Multi-region deployment with active-active configuration
- Recovery Time Objective (RTO): 30 minutes
- Recovery Point Objective (RPO): 5 minutes
- Annual disaster recovery testing
- Documented business continuity plan for telemedicine services

## 9. Healthcare Integration Standards

### 9.1 EHR Integration

- Support for HL7, FHIR, and DirectTrust protocols
- Bidirectional data exchange with major EHR systems
- Single sign-on (SSO) capability with healthcare identity providers
- Structured data capture for clinical documentation

### 9.2 Medical Device Integration

- Support for Bluetooth medical device connectivity
- FDA-compliant device data transmission
- Real-time vital signs monitoring integration
- Standardized API for third-party medical device integration

## 10. Regulatory Compliance

- Maintenance of all relevant telehealth licenses
- Compliance with state-specific telehealth regulations
- International telehealth compliance where applicable
- Regular updates to maintain regulatory compliance
- Documentation provided for customer compliance audits
